message_1:
Calculate the enthalpy of formation of carbon dioxide given the following data:

C(s) + O2(g) → CO2(g) ΔH° = -393.5 kJ/mol

C(s) + 2H2(g) → CH4(g) ΔH° = -74.8 kJ/mol

2H2(g) + O2(g) → 2H2O(l) ΔH° = -571.6 kJ/mol
message_2:
The enthalpy of formation of carbon dioxide is already given in the first reaction:

C(s) + O2(g) → CO2(g) ΔH° = -393.5 kJ/mol

Therefore, the enthalpy of formation of CO2 is -393.5 kJ/mol.
